column4: I'm getting     libdvdread: Could not open /dev/dvd with libdvdcss    when trying to play a dvd with xine.  What could be wrong?
do you have that symlink?
what should it be linked to?
whatever your dvd device is
how would I check?   I typed  'ls -l /dev/dvd' and got   /dev/dvd -> hdd
is your dvd drive secondary slave?
yes
this is my line for my dvd/cdrom drive from fstab        /dev/hdd      /media/cdrom0      udf,iso9660 ro,user,noauto   0     0
you put in a dvd and launched xine, and got an error?
I put in a dvd and typed      'xine -pfhq -V xv --auto-scan dvd'    to try it out before I try it with mythtv
what about just xine dvd://
when I type that I now get     xine engine error  There is no input plugin available to handle 'dvd://'  Maybe MRL syntax is wrong or file/stream source doesn't exist.
I get the same error when trying to play a dvd through the GUI
any other idea?
does mplayer work?
what do i type to try it in mplayer.  i have mplayer-k6 installed
i tried from gmplayer and says      Couldn't open DVD device: /dev/dvd
what permissions are on /dev/hdd?
you know what?  I loged in as the first user I created on the install which is 'ken' and it works.  I was trying from being logged in as user 'mythtv'.  How can I get it to work for my mythtv user?
I figured it out.  I had to put the 'mythtv' user in the cdrom group and now it works
thx for the help for getting me to figure it out
